Eureka ML Insights

eureka_ml_insights.models package

Submodules

eureka_ml_insights.models.models module

Interact with various models, including API-based and HuggingFace models.

This module provides multiple classes that define and manage model interactions, including chat-based and endpoint-based workflows. It handles text-based requests, token counting, and authentication for a variety of model endpoints.

class eureka_ml_insights.models.models.AzureOpenAIClientMixIn

Bases: object

Provide Azure OpenAI-specific client methods and error handling.

get_client()

Retrieve the Azure OpenAI client.

Returns:

The Azure OpenAI client instance.

Return type:

AzureOpenAI

handle_request_error(e)

Handle an error that occurs while making a request to the Azure OpenAI service.

If the error is due to content filtering, this method logs a warning and returns (None, False, True). Otherwise, it logs the exception and returns False.

Parameters:

e (Exception) – The exception raised during the request.

Returns:

Either a tuple indicating a content filter block or False indicating the request can be retried.

Return type:

Union[Tuple[None, bool, bool], bool]

class eureka_ml_insights.models.models.ClaudeModel(api_key=None, secret_key_params=None, chat_mode=False, system_message=None, num_retries=3, model_name=None, temperature=0, max_tokens=2000, top_p=0.95, timeout=60)

Bases: EndpointModel, KeyBasedAuthMixIn

Interact with Claude models through the Python API.

model_name

Name of the Claude model.

Type:

str

temperature

Sampling temperature.

Type:

float

max_tokens

Maximum number of tokens in the generated response.

Type:

int

top_p

Nucleus sampling probability threshold.

Type:

float

timeout

Request timeout in seconds.

Type:

int

chat_mode

Whether the model operates in chat mode (from Model).

Type:

bool

system_message

A system message that can be used by the model (from Model).

Type:

str

num_retries

The number of attempts to retry the request (from EndpointModel).

Type:

int

create_request(text_prompt, query_images=None, system_message=None, previous_messages=None)

Create a request payload for Claude.

Parameters:

  • text_prompt (str) – The user’s prompt.

  • query_images (Any, optional) – Additional images to encode and send. Defaults to None.

  • system_message (str, optional) – A system message to prepend. Defaults to None.

  • previous_messages (list, optional) – A list of previous conversation messages. Defaults to None.

Returns:

A dictionary containing ‘messages’ and optionally ‘system’.

Return type:

dict

get_response(request)

Send a request to the Claude model and get a response.

Parameters:

request (dict) – The request payload to be sent.

Returns:

A dictionary containing “model_output”, “response_time”, and optionally “usage”.

Return type:

dict

handle_request_error(e)

Handle any request error that occurs during Claude inference.

Parameters:

e (Exception) – The exception raised during inference.

Returns:

Always returns False indicating the request was not successful.

Return type:

bool

max_tokens: int = 2000
model_name: str = None
temperature: float = 0
timeout: int = 60
top_p: float = 0.95
class eureka_ml_insights.models.models.ClaudeReasoningModel(api_key=None, secret_key_params=None, chat_mode=False, system_message=None, num_retries=3, model_name=None, temperature=1.0, max_tokens=20000, top_p=None, timeout=600, thinking_enabled=True, thinking_budget=16000)

Bases: ClaudeModel

Interact with Claude reasoning models through the Python API.

Allows usage of a ‘thinking’ parameter for advanced reasoning.

model_name

Name of the Claude reasoning model.

Type:

str

temperature

Sampling temperature.

Type:

float

max_tokens

Maximum number of tokens in the generated response.

Generates a text response, optionally applying a model-specific template.

get_model()

Loads the HuggingFace model and tokenizer.

If quantization is enabled, applies 4-bit quantization. Otherwise, loads the model with standard precision. The tokenizer is also loaded using the same model name.

Loads the LLaVA model and processor.

class eureka_ml_insights.models.models.Model(chat_mode=False, system_message=None)

Bases: ABC

Base class for models.

Any model class should inherit from this class and implement the ‘generate’ method, which returns a dictionary containing ‘model_output’, ‘is_valid’, and any other relevant information.

chat_mode

Whether the model operates in chat mode.

Type:

bool

system_message

A system message that can be used by the model.

chat_mode: bool = False
count_tokens(model_output=None, is_valid=False)

Count the number of tokens in the response.

Uses the tiktoken tokenizer to count tokens in the model’s response. For more information, see: https://github.com/openai/openai-cookbook/blob/main/examples/How_to_count_tokens_with_tiktoken.ipynb

Parameters:

  • model_output (str, optional) – The text response from the model. Defaults to None.

  • is_valid (bool, optional) – Whether the response is valid. Defaults to False.

Returns:

The number of tokens, or None if the response is invalid or None.

Return type:

int or None

class eureka_ml_insights.models.models.OpenAICommonRequestResponseMixIn

Bases: object

Define request and response handling for most OpenAI models.

This mixin provides methods to create a chat request body and parse the response from the OpenAI API.

  • system_message (Optional[str], optional) – The system message to include in the conversation, if any.

class eureka_ml_insights.models.models.VLLMModel(chat_mode=False, system_message=None, model_name=None, trust_remote_code=False, tensor_parallel_size=1, dtype='auto', quantization=None, seed=0, gpu_memory_utilization=0.9, cpu_offload_gb=0, temperature=0.001, top_p=0.95, top_k=-1, max_tokens=2000)

Bases: Model

Runs a self-hosted language model via vLLM APIs.

Uses the chat() functionality of vLLM, which applies a template included in the HF model files. If the model files do not include a template, no template will be applied.
